alert.note: Alert for Pima; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 4:30PM MST until August 09 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN PIMA AND SOUTHEASTERN PINAL COUNTIES... At 430 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. This was also confirmed by multiple rain gauges near Dove Mountain. Flash flooding is likely ongoing, especially across the Dove Mountain area. Watch for increased flows and rapid rises on area washes flowing toward the Rillito River. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tucson, Marana, Casas Adobes, Tortolita, Picture Rocks and Dove Mountain. This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Silverbell Rd near Ina Rd. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
